page.title: 15LOCAL NEWS OCTOBER 1985
page.content:
More stories from local newspapers include:-
BUTCHER SHOP RAIDS; Three local butchers in the Leighton area were counting the cost of the latest series of attacks on their shops by animal liberation campaigners. The protesters claim that annimals are suffering to provide food and that butchers are responsible.
NEW HEATING FOR WOBURN ABBEY; A heating system designed to slash the fuel bill costs for heating Woburn Abbey has been instaled. The system uses boilers that burn waste straw from the estate instead of expesnive fuel oil. Savings of up to Â£30,000 a year are predicted.
